settings.family_intro_text: Designed to withstand corrosion, this burly knife features a full tang blade made with 304 stainless steel, to take on the rigors of salt water adventures. Available as a standalone knife or kit, it’s easily mountable on gear and equipment for quick access while fishing, paddling, diving, or rescue.
settings.family_tip_text: The SPARK, ARC and FLUX are mountable on virtually any surface for lighting up a campsite, backyard or shed.

settings.family_intro_text: Aquaseal FD is tough on rips, holes and tears. With its durable and flexible bond that also resists abrasion, this versatile adhesive can tackle common gear failures without a fuss. Apply it on watersports gear including waders, neoprene wetsuits, and dry bags for a repair that lasts. So, cast that fishing line until the sun goes down or dive deeper into the reefs, with Aquaseal FD your watersports adventure doesn’t have to end.
settings.family_tip_text: You can add color to Aquaseal FD or Aquaseal SR using ceramic pigment found at most craft stores. Just mix it directly into the adhesive prior to application.

settings.family_intro_text: Fully waterproof, Seam Grip WP is an adhesive and sealant for tents and tarps that effectively shelters you from the rain. Wet gear can dampen the spirits of even the most adventurous outdoor enthusiast. Bring a tube of Seam Grip WP with you on your next camping trip to get the job done right and stop leaks.
settings.family_tip_text: If a small section of seam tape on gear has peeled, use Seam Grip WP to re-attach it. If the tape appears to be failing everywhere, remove and discard it. Then clean the seams with isopropyl alcohol and re-seal with Seam Grip WP.

settings.family_intro_text: Revivex Wash-In Water Repellent maximizes breathability and keeps you dry all-season long. Nothing should stop you from shedding the rain or shredding the slopes. Use Revivex Wash-In to waterproof all your beloved outerwear and gear.
settings.family_tip_text: Do not machine wash tents. The agitator can cause damage to the fabric, coatings and seam tape. Clean tents when they are pitched and taut using Revivex Pro Cleaner and rinse off with water.

settings.family_intro_text: Along with nylon and vinyl, Tenacious Tape now sticks to silicone-treated fabrics. Simply peel-and-stick our Silnylon Patches to repair a hole in ultralight silnylon tents, tarps, and more. Backed by a silicone-based adhesive, the Silnylon Patches won’t let you down.
settings.family_tip_text: When strapped for time, apply a Tenacious Tape Repair Patch on top of Aquaseal FD or Seam Grip WP for quicker, in-field repairs.

settings.family_intro_text: Pack our ultra-compact and absorbent microfiber towels on your next mission. These towels dry faster than standard towels, and are treated with silver ions to fight odors. Be prepared in the backwoods or battlefield with a towel that can also be used as a blanket.
settings.family_tip_text: Use our braided Gruntline to hold up to 20 lbs of gear including maps, clothing, helmets, and flashlights when out in the field.

settings.collections_intro_text: Adventure knows no bounds. It’s mountaintops and river bends. It’s fallen trees and autumn leaves. It’s early mornings and full moons. Adventure is out there, and with the right gear, anything is possible. We make products to fix, clean, and protect gear, because when gear performs, so do you. No matter what's ahead, be unstoppable.
settings.collections_tip_text: With Tenacious Tape Mesh Patches, you can cover up any small hole or tear. It will repair bug netting, mesh or no-see-um screens quickly and easily. Just position the mesh, then peel and stick.

settings.doc_title: Aquaseal FD Flexible Durable Repair Adhesive
Seam Grip WP Waterproof Sealant & Adhesive
Seam Grip FC Fast Cure Seam Sealant
Seam Grip TF Tent Fabric Sealant
ARC Rechargeable LED Light + Power Station
FLUX Rechargeable LED Light + Power Station
Sea Buff Dive Mask + Slate Cleaner

settings.faq_content: Whether you’re sealing a tent, rainfly, silnylon tarp, awning or leather shoes, it can be tough to know which sealant to use. Learn which Seam Grip sealant to use on your project.
Whether you’re repairing a wetsuit, waders, shoe sole or a tent, we have an adhesive for you. Learn about the differences between the Aquaseal adhesives and which one to use on your project.
We make Tenacious Tape patches for all types of materials, including GORE-TEX fabric, nylon, mesh, vinyl, inflatables, neoprene, and more. Learn which patch to use for your project.
Learn which anti-fog to use on swim goggles, dive masks, ski goggles, sunglasses, face shields, binoculars and more.

settings.faq_title: How do I store my adhesive so it doesn’t harden in the tube?
settings.faq_content: Seam Grip WP, Aquaseal FD and Aquaseal SR are moisture-cured adhesives that overtime will harden in the tube. Learn how to store your adhesives so you can use them for years.

settings.faq_title: Can I wash or dry my item after I repair it?
settings.faq_content: Yes, after you repair an item with GEAR AID adhesives or tapes you can wash and dry the item. Seam Grip WP and Aquaseal FD are permanent adhesives that will not come off overtime. Additionally, Tenacious Tape can be washed and dried when applied as directed.

settings.faq_title: Do I need to prep the surface?
settings.faq_content: Yes, always clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol prior to making a repair with an adhesive or Tenacious Tape patch. This remove any dirt and residue from the surface, ensuring an ultra-strong bond with the material.

settings.faq_title: How do I care for my knife?
settings.faq_content: Ensure your GEAR AID knife stays ready for years of use by following the simple safety tips and care instructions in this blog post.

settings.faq_title: How do I care for my microfiber towel?
settings.faq_content: Wash your microfiber towel in cold or warm water with a detergent free of fabric softeners. It can be dried on low heat or air dried. Learn more about microfiber in this post.

settings.faq_title: Where can I buy your products?
settings.faq_content: You can find GEAR AID products in retailers nationwide through our dealer locator, as well as in Canada, Mexico, South America, Europe, South Africa, Russia, China, Japan, Taiwan, Singapore, South Korea, Philippines, Malaysia, Mongolia, India,  Australia and New Zealand.

settings.description: We believe in preserving your outdoor gear, outerwear and footwear with our philosophy of Repair, Renew, Reuse. Instead of purchasing new gear every time it rips or tears, repair it by using one of our innovative products to make it last longer.
settings.content:
Your gear is more than just the stuff you need on a weekend camping trip or a trek up the mountains — it’s the tent that can withstand the downpour you weren’t predicting, the down jacket that keeps you warm as you head into work when the temperatures dip, and the wetsuit that protects you when you’re diving into new depths of the ocean. As you hike up, climb down, or bike over on your adventures, your gear is bound to get beat up along the way, sending you back to the outdoor store to replace it. 

When your gear starts to look faded or cracked, renew it by learning how to care for and improve its performance. And when you’re finally ready to upgrade, reuse it by selling, donating, or recycling so that you can reduce waste and help care for this earth we all love to explore. 

Each scratch or gash on your gear tells a tale of where you’ve been and what happened along the way—so why not keep the story going for as long as possible?

settings.title: Repair
settings.content_body:
Part of loving the outdoors is loving its unpredictability — the wildlife that you see on the trails or the huge waves you get when you’re out on dawn patrol —but that can lead to your gear getting torn up when you least expect it. The fear of making a problem worse or not knowing how to approach a gear repair can make you hesitant to take one on. 

Thanks to our step-by-step instructions on patching, sealing, and sewing — plus our innovative and long-lasting adhesives, patches, and zippers — you can  fix your gear and also empower yourself by learning the skill to make a repair on your own. Most importantly, you’ll extend its life, save money, and keep it out of the landfill, all while letting each patch or repaired seam tell a personalized story of your experiences outside.

Imagine not having to give up your beloved waders that were with you on your trip to Big Horn River or that trusty duffle that you’ve taken with you all over the world (or maybe just to the gym and back). With GEAR AID, you don’t have to let go of those memories just yet. Learning how to DIY your own gear repairs instead of sending it off to the manufacturer will also save you time and won’t keep you waiting to head out on your next experience.

settings.content_1: Check out our Tenacious Tape line for the best advice on approaches to patch your outdoor gear.
settings.content_2: Check out our Aquaseal line for the best advice on approaches to repair your outdoor gear.
settings.content_3: Check out our Seam Grip line for the best advice on approaches to Seal your outdoor gear.
settings.content_4: Check out our Revivex line for the best advice on approaches to Seal your outdoor gear.

settings.title: Renew
settings.content_body:
We all have that prized pair of boots that’s helped us climb one more peak or that comfortable tent that’s kept us warm in the middle of a wind storm, but over the months or years of use they may have noticeably become less breathable, less repellent, or less warm. Renewing your gear with protectants, cleaners, and conditioners can increase performance and give the durability that will carry you through your next set of adventures.

Having the latest equipment doesn’t compare with the feeling you get when you slip on your wetsuit that fits just right or tie up your hiking boots that you’ve broken in after miles and miles on the trails.  We want to help you learn to read the signs that your gear needs some TLC — whether that’s visible dirt, fading, wet-out, cracking material, or flattening of the product. 

Knowing how to care for your equipment properly so that it can last as long as you need it. After usage, it’s always best to clean or condition your gear and apply necessary protectants before you use it again—all in the name of extending its life and keeping its performance the same as it was on day one.

settings.title: Top DOs and DONTs
settings.list_1:
• DO read all manufacturer care tags
  • DO hand wash all tents, boots, and wetsuits
  • DO spot test leathers and suedes before you use product on them
  • DO dry down products with wool dryer balls to maintain shape
settings.list_2:
• DON'T use regular detergents with technical fabrics
  • DON'T use high heat with lightweight fabrics
  • DON'T dry your gear in the sun
settings.bottom_content: Before you start your renewal journey, search our DIY care blogs, email us with protectant and gear cleaning questions, or get help from professional services that can determine the right care plan for your gear.

settings.text_content: We believe in preserving the longevity of your outdoor gear, outerwear and footwear with our philosophy of Repair, Renew, Reuse.

settings.title: Reuse
settings.content_body:
You’ve been through a lot with your gear, but there comes a point where you may be interested in upgrading or you’ve simply gotten everything you can out of it. Before you toss it out in the trash bin, take a minute to think about how you can give your old outdoor products a new life — whether that’s selling, donating, recycling, or upcycling it.

Your gear is a major investment and caring for it throughout its life can give you the potential to earn some cash when you’re done using it. If you think your gear still has some decent life left and could be valuable to a fellow outdoor enthusiast, resell it and use the money to put toward a new tent, wetsuit, or that pair of hiking boots you’ve had your eye on. Unsure of where to start?

settings.title: Consignment & Used Gear Organizations
settings.content: Try reselling through Pataonia, The North Face, REI, or even sites like Offer Up

Another way to give new life to your gear is to donate it to an organization that could benefit from its use—from organizations like Gear Forward, which inspires kids to get outside, to nonprofits like Soles4Souls, which assists developing nations with shoe donations.

You could also consider recycling or upcycling your gear so that it gets new purpose. Whether you choose to upcycle your old tent into your child’s new adventure space in the backyard, turn your old pair of boots into a new planter, or opt to donate your gear to programs like Cairn's Give Up, Give Back, and companies who use old equipment to sustainably create new products like Green Guru, Suga Mat, or Lava Rubber, re-using and repurposing your gear helps reduce energy use and waste, while preserving our wildlife and natural places. 

Join us in protecting the outdoors that we love so much by reducing our impact — leaving it better than we found it. This helps ensure the next generation of adventurers can enjoy it for centuries to come.

settings.title: Repair & Maintenance is important
settings.content_1: Gear is more than just the stuff you need on a weekend camping trip or a trek up the mountains—it’s the tent that can withstand the downpour you weren’t predicting, the down jacket that keeps you warm as you head into work when the temperatures dip, and the wetsuit that protects you when you’re diving into new depths of the ocean. As you hike up, climb down, or bike over on your adventures, your gear is bound to get beat up along the way, sending you back to the outdoor store to replace it.
settings.content_2: Join us in celebrating this earth we love so much by reducing our impact leaving it better than we found so that the next generations of adventurers can enjoy it for centuries to come.

settings.title: Repair. Renew. Reuse.
settings.content: We believe in preserving the longevity of outdoor gear, outerwear and footwear. Our goal is to educate gear users to repair instead of replacing—to purchase used and to extend the life of gear no matter what the state. Our philosophy is born from a place of buying quality gear, taking care of it, and passing it along for future use once it’s served it’s purpose.
settings.box_1_text: We focus first on ways to help you to care for and repair your outdoor gear, rather than purchase something new.  We only make products that you will use frequently and know will stand up to years of use in tough conditions.
settings.box_2_text: We work every day to lessen our impact on the environment, by eliminating harmful components from our products, and by being more efficient with the energy and natural resources that we consume.
settings.box_3_text: We work to find new ways to make your experiences in the outdoors more joyful, and  memorable. We take the same tenacious, curious, and resourceful approach to solving the problems you face every day.

settings.title: Find what will fix your gear
settings.content: Adventure knows no bounds. It’s mountaintops and river bends. It’s fallen trees and autumn leaves. It’s early mornings and full moons. Adventure is out there, and with the right gear, anything is possible. We makes products to fix, clean, and protect gear, because when gear performs, so do you. No matter what's ahead, be unstoppable.

settings.title: GEAR UP, TIE DOWN
settings.sub_title: Fasten gear easily and securely with the Heavy-Duty 1100 Paracord.

settings.title: BRING ON CAMPING
settings.sub_title: Learn to prep camp gear in 5 steps.

settings.title: PATCH MISHAPS
settings.sub_title: Fix torn GORE-TEX® or down jackets with iron-on & peel-and-stick patches.

settings.title: Silnylon Patches
settings.sub_title: Our newest patch can now repair silnylon tents and tarps.

settings.title: Renewed Gear. Renewed Adventure.
settings.content:
We believe in preserving the longevity of outdoor gear, outerwear, and footwear. Our goal is to educate people to repair instead of replacing, to purchase used whenever possible, and to extend the life of gear so it can stay out of the landfill.

Our philosophy begins with buying quality gear, taking care of it, and passing it along for future use.
settings.box_1_text: We focus on solutions to care for and maintain outdoor gear, instead of purchasing something new. We make products that will be used frequently and will stand up to years of use in tough conditions.
settings.box_2_text: We are committed to lessen our impact on the environment, by eliminating harmful components from our products and by being more efficient with the energy and natural resources that we consume.
settings.box_3_text: We find meaningful ways to make your experiences in the outdoors more joyful and memorable. We take the same tenacious, curious, and resourceful approach to solving the problems that may arise during an adventure.

settings.title: Include repair in your story
settings.content_1: Gear is more than just the stuff you need on a weekend camping trip or a trek up the mountains. It’s the tent that can withstand the downpour you weren’t expecting, the down jacket that keeps you warm as you head into work when the temperatures dip, and the wetsuit that protects you when you’re diving into new depths in the ocean. As you hike up, climb down, or bike over on your adventures, gear is bound to get beat up along the way. Rather than going back to the store to replace it, fix gear with your own hands.
settings.content_2: Join us in celebrating this earth we love so much by reducing our impact through gear care and maintenance. Let’s do our part to leave our outdoors spaces as good as we found it, so future generations can continue to enjoy adventures outside.

settings.title: Recommended OEM Products
settings.content: Our line of care and maintenance products are used by industry leaders in gear manufacturing and warranty repair departments. From sealants to lubricants and repair tape, we have the right product assortment to solve virtually any gear problem.
settings.aquaseal_content: There’s no need to replace that wetsuit that fits just right or those boots you’ve finally broken in—fix them permanently with Aquaseal, our line of ultra-strong repair adhesives backed with more than 35 years of in-field experience.
settings.aquaseal_prod_copy_1: Fix all types of rips, tears and holes in waders, wetsuits, and outdoor gear for a clear, flexible, and waterproof repair that lasts.
settings.aquaseal_prod_copy_2: Tackle rips and tears in waders, wetsuits, and muck boots with the Cure Accelerator to be back in the water within two hours.
settings.aquaseal_prod_copy_3: Expose this quick-curing adhesive to sunlight or ultraviolet light for instant repairs in the backcountry or on-the-go.
settings.aquaseal_prod_copy_4: Repair torn neoprene and other coated materials permanently with this specially formulated, black adhesive.
settings.seam_grip_content: You never let a little weather slow you down, so why start now? Seam Grip, our waterproof line of sealants, stops leaks in tarps, tents, sleeping pads, waders, rain jackets, and more. Use them to seal up your favorite equipment that will stick by your side for years to come.
settings.seam_grip_prod_copy_1: Keep moisture out by sealing up to 12 ft of tents, tarps, and awnings with a single 1 oz tube of this permanent waterproof sealant.
settings.seam_grip_prod_copy_2: Seal all silicone-treated gear including nylon tarps and ultralight backpacks. A single 1.5 oz tube can seal up to 24 ft of seams.
settings.seam_grip_prod_copy_3: Get all the essential gear repair tools in this one kit, which includes a waterproof sealant and two peel-and-stick patches in a compact twist tube.
settings.seam_grip_prod_copy_4: Restore the waterproof, polyurethane coating in tents with this clear sealant using its built-in foam applicator brush.
settings.revivex_content: Keep your gear performing just as well as it did on day one. Our line of Revivex cleaners, conditioners, and protectants can restore your gear, make it last longer, and help you be more comfortable in whatever kind of outdoor activity you do—from hiking, fishing, kayaking, or even just walking from your car to your office.
settings.revivex_prod_copy_1: Restore the DWR coating on GORE-TEX® jackets and waterproof-breathable outerwear.
settings.revivex_prod_copy_2: Wash down jackets and sleeping bags and restore loft without stripping natural oils in down feathers.
settings.revivex_prod_copy_3: Extend the life of neoprene wetsuits, drysuits, booties, and gloves properly without damaging such expensive gear.
settings.revivex_prod_copy_4: Remove persistent smells, body odor, and pet funk with this natural formula that works as a spray, soak, or wash.
settings.tenacious_tape_content: Tears and rips can happen—especially when you’re active. Tenacious Tape, our line of repair tapes and patches, are ready for nearly any kind of slash, cut, crack, or break in your nylon, silnylon, polyester, neoprene, vinyl, rubber and GORE-TEX® fabric gear. Choose from peel-and-stick or iron-on options that are both washable and weatherproof for extreme durability.

settings.title: Brands We Work With
settings.content: By educating and collaborating with brands that manufacture outdoor gear, we promote the importance of championing renewal and help raise consumer awareness of repair and maintenance in our everyday lives. Here are some of the brands we partner with that support our belief that gear maintenance leads to knowledge and confidence – no matter what type of adventure you’re into.

settings.title: Get a Hold of Us
settings.content: We are recognized by outdoor industry professionals as the leader in care and repair. Aligning your brand with our products supports a more sustainable business. If you or your organization are interested in partnering with GEAR AID, please fill out the form below with your information and we will respond to your inquiry.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
settings.faq_title_1: I can’t find what I need on your website. Is this all you offer?
settings.faq_content_1: In many cases, it is best to utilize our regularly stocked options and finished products we can provide to you in retail-ready GEAR AID packaging. Please contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com to discuss your ideas and custom product needs.
settings.faq_title_2: Can I purchase your product for use as an inclusionary item?
settings.faq_content_2: Yes, depending on the product desired, configuration, and our agreement.
settings.faq_title_3: Are all of your products available in bulk?
settings.faq_content_3: No. Some of our products are produced and finished only in retail ready GEAR AID branded packaging.
settings.faq_title_4: What are your minimum order quantities (MOQs)?
settings.faq_content_4:
• Bulk product: Master case quantities (vary depending on products) 

• All others: Contact salesorders@gearaid.com for more information.
settings.faq_title_5: Can I get samples of the products I am interested in?
settings.faq_content_5: Yes, we are happy to provide you with the samples you may need. Please contact your account manager or submit a request at salesorders@gearaid.com. Not all requests can be fulfilled, but we will do our best to provide as much detail and materials for your development needs.
settings.faq_title_6: Can I cobrand or private label your product with my branding and/or packaging to resell?
settings.faq_content_6: In some cases, we will partner with brands and develop unique cobranded packaging. Total private label development may also be an option depending on the product desired and the industry it is being sold into. We have a limited amount of products that are offered as a cobrand / private label. New private label orders require a 50% down payment prior to production. Please contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com for more information.
settings.faq_content_7: Yes, we can. Any customization outside of our standard production SKUs or inventoried components will require a full product development process specific to our capabilities and your needs. We work with many domestic and global suppliers that can help to achieve your goals.
settings.faq_title_8: Can you assist with packaging design?
settings.faq_content_8: We are available to assist with most design projects and can provide direction with content, instructions, and art layout.  Design and development services may be subject to an additional hourly art fee.
settings.faq_title_9: Do you have an in-house design department?
settings.faq_content_9: Yes, our design department is on staff at our headquarters in Bellingham, WA. Contact your account manager for more information and pricing.
settings.faq_content_10: All GEAR AID products come with standard use instructions. We can work with you to tailor fit instructions, so your product needs and specifications are being met. Regulatory and warning statements are non-negotiable and are essential packaging requirements.
settings.faq_title_11: Are your products in compliance with REACH / Prop65?
settings.faq_content_11: All our products that require Prop 65 warnings are properly packaged and labeled with the current www.p65warnings.ca.gov information. Many of our products are REACH compliant, packaged and labeled for sales in NorthAmerica. Our GEAR AID products can be available with EU country language translations and regulatory requirements for retail sales within the EU. Please inquire for more details with your GEAR AID account manager.
settings.faq_title_12: Do you have certain quality standards?
settings.faq_content_12: Yes, our products are built to meet specific standards of formulation and performance.  Our Project Management team reviews each product and design to ensure that those specifications are met.
settings.faq_content_13:
Each product we offer has different availability and shipping requirements. To find out when you can expect to receive your order, contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com. The following are some standard lead-times we work hard to fulfill:

• 3 days: Bulk product within North America in master case quantities. 

• 2 weeks: International shipments.• 10-12 weeks: Co-brand / private label from approval of design.

* Receipt times will depend on shipping arrangements andFOB (free on board) location.
settings.faq_title_14: Will you warehouse my inventory or have a stocking program?
settings.faq_content_14: Our warehouse is not directly set up to inventory and ship customer product. Our OEM production and finished goods are required to betaken in full at the time of completion and invoicing. If warehouse/stocking services are needed please inquire with your account manager as some special cases may apply.
settings.faq_content_16: We ship from our headquarters in Bellingham, WA, USA.
settings.faq_title_17: Can you ship directly to my manufacturing factory?
settings.faq_content_17: Yes, the majority of our products are available FOB from Bellingham, WA.
settings.faq_title_18: Do any of your products have import or shipping restrictions?
settings.faq_content_18: Yes. Our team is able to assist with necessary documentation for your process of importation.
settings.faq_title_19: Do you ship outside of the USA?
settings.faq_content_19: Any products shipped outside the USA is the sole responsibility of the customer for any and all duties and/or customs fees and regulatory requirements. For more information on our overseas shipping capabilities, please contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com.
settings.faq_title_20: Is freight included in my orders?
settings.faq_content_20: All orders placed with GEAR AID can be shipped using our freight coordinator or one of your preferred carriers. All freight charges will be billed as a separate item on the invoice.
settings.faq_title_21: How do I get pricing information?
settings.faq_content_21: Pricing for all products and services are available through your account manager at salesorders@gearaid.com
settings.faq_title_22: What form of payment do you accept?
settings.faq_content_22: We gladly accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and AmericanExpress. GEAR AID is able to offer NET 30 days payment terms with prior approval. Contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com to learn about our payment terms and for a NET 30 credit application. New private label orders require a 50% down payment with the balance being due at the time the finished goods are ready to ship or based on your payment terms.
settings.faq_title_23: How else can we help you?

Adventure is out there, and with the right gear, anything is possible. We makes products to fix, clean, and protect gear, because when gear performs, so do you. No matter what's ahead, be unstoppable.

settings.title: Help Center

settings.title: Spring Tent Care: How to Waterproof, Patch, Clean and More
settings.text: “Products like GEAR AID Tenacious Tape Patches tackle tears and pokes like a pro. And they’re basically idiot-proof. Use a little rubbing alcohol to clear around the breach, cut the tape or patch to fit the hole, then stick it on. Presto!”

settings.title: 29 Items Your Ultimate Bug-Out Bag Should Have
settings.text: “This [paracord] has a multitude of uses, from constructing a ridge line for a shelter to using as fishing line to (obviously) tying things together...the reflective cord can be a useful way to signal rescuers. Apparently paracord is so useful that people like to make it into bracelets...I’m happy enough with it in a bag.”

settings.title: The Best Camp Light of 2020
settings.text: “Multifunction lights can be clunky, with too many pieces to keep track of. Not GEAR AID’s 4.5-ounce system. The tough plastic capsule clips to your pack’s strap or screws into a sternum attachment for biking. Don’t be fooled by its 110 lumens—it comes in handy on the trail and at base camp.”

settings.title: / Mission
settings.heading: GEAR AID champions renewal for those who play and work outside
settings.content:
We know adventure and the gear that is essential for it. For more than 35 years, we’ve been seeking to solve gear problems by empowering people to make gear last longer. We created products that fix and restore gear as well as enhance the outdoor experience. With more than 100 quality products including Aquaseal®, Seam Grip®, Revivex®, and Tenacious Tape®, we make gear better and adventures bigger.

Our mission is to champion renewal while staying connected to the outdoors. When gear fails, GEAR AID is at your side. By maintaining gear yourself, through care and repair, we can all help reduce waste by extending its life for years to come.

settings.title: / Activity
settings.heading: What Gets You Outside?
settings.content: Whether you're camping, fishing, paddling, or hunting, gear is essential. When it breaks, fix your gear right, so it continues to keep you outdoors – rain or shine.

settings.title: / Stories
settings.heading: REPAIR. REUSE. RENEW.
settings.content: We believe in preserving outdoor gear, outerwear and footwear through our Repair, Renew, Reuse philosophy. When gear rips or tears, repair it by using one of our easy-to-use products to make it last longer. Each gash or scratch tells a tale, so keep the story going for as long as possible.

settings.title: Aquaseal
settings.heading: Fix Anything
settings.text: There’s no need to replace that wetsuit that fits just right, or those boots you’ve finally broken in—fix them permanently with Aquaseal. This durable line of repair adhesives fixes rips and tears so you can keep adventuring year after year.

settings.title: Seam Grip
settings.heading: Stop Leaks
settings.text: You’ve never let a little rain slow you down, so why start now? Seam Grip, our waterproof sealants, stop leaks in tarps, tents, sleeping pads, waders, rain jackets, and more. Use them to seal up your favorite equipment that will stick by your side for years to come.

settings.title: Revivex
settings.heading: Revitalize + Protect Gear
settings.text: Keep gear performing just as well as it did on day one. Revivex cleaners, conditioners, and protectants restore jackets, wetsuits, and more to make it last longer – keeping you comfortable whether you’re hiking, fishing, kayaking, or even just walking to and from your car.

settings.title: Tenacious Tape
settings.heading: Patch Mishaps
settings.text: Tears and rips can happen—especially when you’re active. Tenacious Tape repair tapes and patches are ready for nearly any kind of slash, rip, or cut. Use it on nylon, silnylon, neoprene, GORE-TEX® fabric, and more. Choose from peel-and-stick or iron-on options that are washable and weatherproof.

settings.title: Adventure Tools
settings.heading: Gear Up and Go
settings.text: Just because you’re outside doesn’t mean you have to rough it. Get the gear so you can love the outdoors even more. Our Adventure Tools are designed to make camping, diving, hiking, biking, and simply being outside better. A lot better.

settings.title: / Collections
settings.heading: be a problem solver
settings.text: Whatever gets you stoked outside we have the products that keep outdoor gear performing the way it should. From the cities to the forests and the mountains to the oceans, we’re with you on adventures big and small – to help solve gear problems. Browse our collections to find out how.

settings.text1: Since 1981, the outdoor industry has chosen GEAR AID for gear-specific solutions. Backed by decades of field experience and problem-solving expertise, we facilitated more than 3.5 million repairs in 2020. This illustrates our extensive knowledge in gear maintenance and ability to anticipate and solve gear problems. Our industry is evolving and we’re here to connect and bring the proper tools of repair to everyone.
settings.sectiontext1: GEAR AID+ serves outdoor industry brands that want to introduce DIY gear repair and maintenance to their customers. We provide the wisdom, expertise, and knowledge to solve gear problems with a range of products.
settings.sectiontext2: Equipping customers with the tools of DIY repair creates a deep connection between a brand and its consumers. The reward of DIY and gear care with GEAR AID+ gets people out on more adventures.
settings.sectiontext3: As the experts in anticipating gear problems, we know how to take care of our customers for their current and future needs. We are available to support our partners throughout the process from development to launch.
settings.bottomText1: On average, 40% of a product’s environmental impact is attributed to product care and end of life disposal (Outdoor Industry Association, 2019). That’s why we help gear last as long as possible. We understand producing high quality outdoor gear is a major investment and maintaining it can reduce environmental waste.
settings.bottomText2: A jacket, whether insulated or waterproof, requires regular washing and conditioning to keep up its performance and make it last longer.

settings.title: WHO WE WORK WITH
settings.title2: We are recognized by outdoor industry professionals as the leader in gear repair and maintenance.

settings.heading:
PRODUCTION / 
MANUFACTURING
settings.content: GEAR AID+ can provide products in bulk to be used in manufacturing and production. As a business that does manufacturing, we can work directly with factories both domestic and globally. Contact us with details about your products, what they are made out of, and where in your supply chain you are looking to incorporate GEAR AID.

settings.heading:
ADD-ON / 
INCLUSIONARY
settings.content: To anticipate the future needs and repair issues of customers, GEAR AID can be incorporated to accommodate the design and lifecycle of your product. Inclusionary options might include one repair product or a kit of complementary repair items. Add-on products are included with the product at sale with instructions for use down the line. Integrating gear repair into your brand elevates the connection with customers.

settings.heading:
PROMOTION / 
MARKETING
settings.content: Introducing your customers to DIY repair highlights your brand’s efforts to focus on gear care and maintenance. This goal can be achieved with retail inclusionary items like gifts-with-purchase during the holiday season, retail promotions surrounding gear care education and classes, or events. For example, care and repair can be fun with fun patch shapes and instructions included in each product sold.

settings.heading:
WARRANTY / 
SERVICE
settings.content: GEAR AID+ can provide a range of repair products to appropriately prepare your team for varying repairs. Products can be ordered in bulk for programs like a retail repair service, warranty department, secondhand gear resell, or gear care education. GEAR AID is a trusted source on how to fix, clean, and restore gear. We know the joy that a repaired piece of gear can bring, and we want to help your brand build that trust with your customers.

settings.title: TECHNICAL PROBLEMS
settings.text: We work with you directly to customize solutions to support your product and business initiatives. Each program type delivers applicable product offerings within the GEAR AID+ program. Each phase is specifically designed to match the product lifecycle from manufacturing to end use.

settings.title: GEAR AID PRODUCTS
settings.text: GEAR AID repair and maintenance products are used by industry leading gear manufacturers and warranty repair departments. From sealants to lubricants, wash treatments to repair tape, we have the right product assortment to solve any gear problem.

settings.title: PARTNER WITH US
settings.text: Ready to partner with GEAR AID? Have questions? Please choose a path below and we will respond to your inquiry.
settings.text2: We look forward to meeting you.

settings.title: Download files
settings.text: Learn how to use our products

settings.title: Product Videos
settings.text: Watch how to use our products

settings.title: FAQ's
settings.text: Find answers to your questions

settings.title: PRODUCT RESOURCES
settings.text: Whether you’re a brand interested in partnering with us or a customer with a question, we’re here to help. Our range of product resources can help you learn how to use our products and understand more technical details.

settings.question: Are all of your products available in bulk?
settings.answer: No. Some of our products are produced and finished only in retail ready GEAR AID branded packaging.

settings.question: What are your minimum order quantities (MOQs)?
settings.answer:
Bulk product: Master case quantities (vary depending on products)

All others: Contact salesorders@gearaid.com for more information

settings.question: Can I get samples of the products I am interested in?
settings.answer: Yes, we are happy to provide you with the samples you may need. Please contact your account manager or submit a request at salesorders@gearaid.com. Not all requests can be fulfilled, but we will do our best to provide as much detail and materials for your development needs.

settings.question: Do you provide custom sizes?
settings.answer: Yes, we can. Any customization outside of our standard production SKUs or inventoried components will require a full product development process specific to our capabilities and your needs. We work with many domestic and global suppliers that can help to achieve your goals. Contact salesorder@gearaid.com for MOQs and order requirements.

settings.question: Do you have an in-house design department?
settings.answer: Yes, our design department is on staff at our headquarters in Bellingham, WA. Contact your account manager for more information and pricing.

settings.question: Do you provide use instructions?
settings.answer: All GEAR AID products come with standard use instructions. We can work with you to tailor fit instructions, so your product needs and specifications are being met. Regulatory and warning statements are non-negotiable and are essential packaging requirements.

settings.question: Are your products in compliance with REACH / Prop65?
settings.answer: All our products that require Prop 65 warnings are properly packaged and labeled with the current www.p65warnings.ca.gov information. Many of our products are REACH compliant, packaged and labeled for sales in NorthAmerica. Our GEAR AID products can be available with EU country language translations and regulatory requirements for retail sales within the EU. Please inquire for more details with your GEAR AID account manager.

settings.question: Do you have certain quality standards?
settings.answer: Yes, our products are built to meet specific standards of formulation and performance.  Our Project Management team reviews each product and design to ensure that those specifications are met.

settings.question: What are typical lead times?
settings.answer:
Each product we offer has different availability and shipping requirements. To find out when you can expect to receive your order, contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com. The following are some standard lead-times we work hard to fulfill:

3 days: Bulk product within North America in master case quantities. 

2 weeks: International shipments.• 10-12 weeks: Co-brand / private label from approval of design.

* Receipt times will depend on shipping arrangements andFOB (free on board) location.

settings.question: Will you warehouse my inventory or have a stocking program?
settings.answer: Our warehouse is not directly set up to inventory and ship customer product. Our OEM production and finished goods are required to be taken in full at the time of completion and invoicing. If warehouse/stocking services are needed please inquire with your account manager as some special cases may apply.

settings.question: Where do you ship from?
settings.answer: We ship from our headquarters in Bellingham, WA, USA.

settings.question: Can you ship directly to my manufacturing factory?
settings.answer: Yes, the majority of our products are available FOB from Bellingham, WA.

settings.question: Do any of your products have import or shipping restrictions?
settings.answer: Yes. Our team is able to assist with necessary documentation for your process of importation.

settings.question: Do you ship outside of the USA?
settings.answer: Any products shipped outside the USA is the sole responsibility of the customer for any and all duties and/or customs fees and regulatory requirements. For more information on our overseas shipping capabilities, please contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com.

settings.question: Is freight included in my orders?
settings.answer: All orders placed with GEAR AID can be shipped using our freight coordinator or one of your preferred carriers. All freight charges will be billed as a separate item on the invoice.

settings.question: How do I get pricing information?
settings.answer: Pricing for all products and services are available through your account manager at salesorders@gearaid.com.

settings.question: What form of payment do you accept?
settings.answer: We gladly accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and AmericanExpress. GEAR AID is able to offer NET 30 days payment terms with prior approval. Contact us at salesorders@gearaid.com to learn about our payment terms and for a NET 30 credit application. New private label orders require a 50% down payment with the balance being due at the time the finished goods are ready to ship or based on your payment terms.

settings.question: How else can we help you?
